intro.description: You can control where the Map Editor is looking by using the navigation tools. The navigation tools are located in the tool bar along the top of the screen.

item.title: Zoom Tool
item.description: The Zoom Tool is available by default. You can activate the tool by clicking it in the tool bar.

item.title: Zoom In Selection
item.description: Use the Zoom Tool by drawing a box, using the left mouse button, around the area of the map you wish to see.

item.title: Zoom Out Selection
item.description: To Zoom Out draw a box with the right mouse button. The current map will be located within the box you draw.

item.title: Zoom In
item.description: The Zoom In Tool can be used to change the scale by a fixed amount. Clicking the tool once will zoom the map in one level, clicking it again will zoom the map out a further level.

item.title: Zoom Out
item.description: The Zoom Out Tool can be used to change the scale by a fixed amount. Clicking the tool once will zoom out the map by one level, clicking in again will zoom the map out a further level.

item.title: Zoom To Extent
item.description: The Show All Tool can be used to return the map to its full size at any time. Click the tool once to zoom to the full extent.

item.title: Pan Tool
item.description: The Pan Tool can be used to scroll around your map with out changing the scale. You can activate the tool by clicking it in the tool bar.

item.title: Pan Map
item.description: Using the left mouse button Click and Drag the map to pan out the area you wish to view.
